items.from_string:
Title: 1.5 - Provide adhoc support to Innovation team to resolve technical issues

Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant on the Innovation team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays.

Acceptance Criteria: When a user from Innovation team requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed. Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved. Update deployment dates in Confluence for each support ticket.

items.from_string: Update Image Builder Webhook Caller Template to Support Multiple Target Pipelines
items.to_string:
As a dev ops engineer, I want a reusable Harness step template that calls the Image Builder pipeline via webhook, so that multiple different application pipelines can use the same template to trigger Image Builder with their own configuration (repo, tag, language, paths, etc.) without duplicating logic.
We currently have a Bash script used in a Run step that: Constructs a JSON payload from pipeline variables (environment, ECR repo, tag, Dockerfile directory, repo name, branch, resources, language, etc.). Sends that payload to the Image Builder pipeline via a webhook URL (ImageBuilderWebhook). Parses the trigger response using jq. Polls the provided apiUrl until the Image Builder execution finishes, failing the calling pipeline on non-success.
Reusable as a Harness Step Template The “Call Image Builder via Webhook” logic is encapsulated in a step template (e.g., a Run step template) in Harness. Any pipeline can include this template without copying the script.

Title: Add lambda invocation to ARIA

Value Statement: As a ml engineer I want to be able to invoke lambda so in the future strands integration can be supported

AC: Permissions and code added to invoke a lambda from aria api

Title: eMPWR KT Value Statement: As a tenant ML Engineer who wants to assist the tenant in all ways appropriate, I need to understand the tenant's use cases and code so that I can assist where needed.

Acceptance Criteria:

-When any/all meetings have occurred between the previous SE over the tenant.

-When the new SE has met the tenant team and discussed the work.

-When the new SE has reviewed the tenant code and become technically familiar with the project.

Title: Create notebook tutorial for AWS Comprehend within BIP-AI

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI tenant who wants to use AWS comprehend to extract information from text, I want an example notebook to demonstrate how to do so on the BIP-AI platform.

Acceptance Criteria: - Jupyter notebook explaining core Comprehend concepts relevant to BIP-AI. - Functional code moved to mlkit - enforced tagging of resources.

Title: Create domain environment setup unified pipeline

Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer on the BIP-AI team, I want to create a unified pipeline for domain environment setup so that a domain can easily be provisioned.

AC: A single Jenkins pipeline is created in all environments that attaches the BIP AI Stable Jupyterlab and CodeEditor LCCs and attaches the custom image all in one combined pipeline Documentation should be added on how to run this pipeline Should be able to be run on new domains as well as updating existing domains, and should be run automatically when a new mlkit version is released

Title: Dedup agentic trace logs

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps engineer who is monitoring tenant-agentic applications, I need to correct the current agentic module to remove duplicate logging to reduce logging overhead and redundancy.

AC: - update agentic module to remove redundancy - manual testing and screenshots are shared in PR

items.from_string: Update resource naming conventions to use application ID for tag manager compatibility and consistency
items.to_string:
Title: Update resource naming conventions to use application ID for tag manager compatibility and consistency

Story: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I want to replace product-tenant with application ID in all naming conventions so that templates are consistent with the tenant directory, costing, and the new tag manager. Assumptions: - Application ID values match the product-tenant combination (e.g., product "bip" + tenant "ai" = application ID "bip-ai") - The new tag manager requires application ID for proper resource tagging Acceptance Criteria: - Given all composition and template files when I replace product-tenant references with application ID then all naming conventions use the new format - Given the updated naming conventions when I compare generated resource names then no actual name changes occur due to value equivalence - Given updated templates when I render charts for all environments then the output matches expected resource names - Given the refactored templates when I deploy to SBX environment then all resources deploy successfully with correct tags - Given the new naming convention when documentation exists then it is updated to reflect the application ID usage Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (chart rendering validation for all environments) - Documentation updated (if applicable) - Successfully deployed and validated in SBX environment - All composition and template files updated consistently

items.from_string: Refactor claims values files into modular components to reduce complexity and improve maintainability
items.to_string:
Title: Refactor claims values files into modular components to reduce complexity and improve maintainability

**Title:** Refactor claims values files into modular components to reduce complexity and improve maintainability **Story:** As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I want to organize claim values into separate files so that file complexity is reduced and maintenance is simplified. **Assumptions:** - File structure changes are compatible with existing ArgoCD application sets and Helm rendering - Multiple values files or include mechanisms are supported by the chart structure **Acceptance Criteria:** - Given existing claims values files when I establish a baseline then I generate and save the rendered chart output for each environment - Given refactored values files when I render the charts then the output matches the baseline for all environments with no functional changes - Given the new file organization when separating resource groups then each values file is focused on a single concern and is easier to navigate - Given the refactored structure when I deploy to SBX environment then all claims deploy successfully without errors - Given the new file organization when documentation is updated then it clearly explains the structure, file naming conventions, and how to modify values **Definition of Done:** - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (chart rendering validation for all environments) - Documentation updated (README with new structure explanation) - Successfully deployed and validated in SBX environment - Baseline and post-refactor chart outputs verified as identical
This issue is cloned by BIP-30348

Title: Deploy application to Kubernetes using Crossplane k8s-app composition

### Value Statement As a platform engineer managing application deployments, I need to deploy a test application to Kubernetes using the k8s-app Crossplane composition so that I can leverage standardized, declarative infrastructure-as-code patterns for consistent and repeatable deployments.

### Acceptance Criteria A test API or strands agent is successfully launched onto the sbx k8s cluster and is reachable from other services.

Title: Add testing and validation step to EVA's CI/CD jenkins pipeline

Value Statement: As a BIP AI mlops engineer who supports EVA, I need the ability to run tests and validation in EVA's jenkins pipeline so that I can ensure code quality and functionality before deploying changes.

AC: Convert EVA's notebooks into pytests that can be run by the pipeline Add steps to run tests and validate code to EVA's jenkins pipeline.
This issue is cloned by BIP-29961

Title: Extract transaction details in letters with more than one transaction

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI mlops engineer supporting eMPWR, I need to have the ability to extract all details properly from a limited pay letter so that eMPWR team can properly use these details downstream

Acceptance Criteria: - modification of proposed blueprint and/or configuration of project - manual testing and validation of blueprint on different samples of pay letters

Value Statement: As a solutions engineer supporting the claims sum team, I need to validate the the new claims sum domain to ensure its in a fully functional state and all permissions have been provisioned.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Performed domain validation on new claims sum domain
- Ensured inference profiles for nova models are in a working state

Dependencies: Claims Sum intake completed

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer, I want to create a reusable step template for Playwright tests in Harness, so that I can standardize Playwright execution (using a pre-built image and configuration) and easily reuse this step across pipelines and accelerators.
 
Acceptance Criteria: Playwright Step Template Definition Given I am in the Harness template library When I create a new step template for Playwright Then: The step template is of the correct type (e.g., container/script step appropriate for running Playwright). The template can be versioned and stored in the shared template library. Pre-Built Image with Playwright Given there is a container image with Playwright pre-installed When I configure the step template Then: The template references this image in its configuration. The image includes all necessary Playwright dependencies (Node.js, browsers, drivers, fonts, etc.). The image location (registry URL/tag) can be configured or overridden via inputs if required. Configurable Playwright Command & Arguments
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer / platform engineer I want the testing and deployment strategy documentation to clearly describe how AWS Lambda services are deployed to the Dev environment using Harness deployment workflows So that developers and release engineers can consistently and safely deploy Lambda changes to Dev, following a standard, well-documented process
 
Acceptance Criteria: Update the Testing and Deployment Strategy document with the relevant updates from harness.

items.from_string:
Title: Record end‑to‑end Harness demo: image build through Lambda deployment
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer / enablement lead, I want to record an end-to-end Harness demo that shows the image builder pipeline executing into a Lambda deployment pipeline, so that stakeholders can clearly see the full automated flow from image build to Lambda function deployment and use the recording for training, onboarding, and enablement.
Acceptance Criteria: Scenario & Flow Definition Given I am preparing the demo When I define the scenario Then: The flow must cover: code change → image build pipeline execution → output artifact/image → Lambda deployment pipeline execution using that artifact. The specific pipelines, services, and environments used in the demo are documented (names, purpose, and relationships).
items.to_string:
As a DevOps engineer,
I want to configure KMS and ECR policies to allow Cosign to use the BIP signing key stored in KMS for ECR image signing
So that container images pushed to ECR can be securely signed and verified using the centralized BIP key with proper access controls in place.Acceptance Criteria
Ensuring the BIP signing key is created or imported into AWS KMS in the appropriate account(s) and region(s).
Defining and applying appropriate KMS key policies and IAM policies so that:
The CI/CD pipeline / image builder role can use the BIP key for signing (e.g., kms:Sign, kms:GetPublicKey as relevant).
Only approved principals can administer or use the key (principle of least privilege).
Validating that Cosign can retrieve and use the BIP key from KMS during the ECR image signing process.
Ensuring ECR is configured such that signed images and their signatures can be stored, discovered, and verified (e.g., Cosign-compatible OCI artifacts in ECR).

 * - alert description contains list of inference profiles throttling

Title: Configure Slack alerts for unified Jenkins deployment pipeline

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer who created the unified endpoint deployment pipeline, I need the ability to configure slack alerts so there is a centralized place for notifications

Acceptance Criteria: When a solutions engineer triggers the unified deployment pipeline, they have the ability to view alerts (failures, successes, etc.) in slack

items.from_string:
Title: Add Reusable Functional Code from Lambda Tutorial Notebook into mlkit Repository

Value Statement: As a BIP MLOps engineer, I want to extract and centralize reusable Lambda-related utility code from the Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook into the shared mlkit repository, so that commonly used functions and classes can be easily imported and maintained across multiple projects without code duplication.

Description: The Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook currently includes functional code (e.g., Lambda creation, configuration, and invocation helpers) that can be reused in other notebooks and pipelines. This task involves identifying such reusable code segments, refactoring them into standalone Python modules within the mlkit repository, and updating the tutorial notebook to import those utilities instead of redefining them locally. This will promote better maintainability, consistency, and reusability across all projects using Lambda or SageMaker automation.

Acceptance Criteria: Code Identification - Review the Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook and identify all code components suitable for reuse (e.g., Lambda creation, invocation, S3 interaction, logging utilities). Refactoring and Module Creation - Move reusable logic into the mlkit repository under an appropriate directory - Ensure code is modular, well-documented, and follows internal coding standards. - Functions and classes should include docstrings and type hints. Testing - Add or update unit tests in the mlkit repo to verify the moved code functions as expected. Notebook Update - Update the Lambda Usage Tutorial Notebook to import the refactored functions/classes from mlkit. Documentation - Add or update README/documentation within mlkit describing the new utilities and their usage.
items.to_string:
Title: Script to Update API Gateway for Existing Lambda and SageMaker Endpoints Value Statement: As a tenant platform engineer who manages deployment configurations, I need the ability to update existing API Gateway routes for Lambda functions and SageMaker endpoints so that the APIs are properly routed and accessible after deployment changes.

Acceptance Criteria: - The API Gateway reflects the correct integration targets and routes.
This issue is cloned by BIP-29982
